com.samysadi.acs.core.notifications

Class NotificationListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samysadi.acs.core.notifications.NotificationListener
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EventNotificationListener, InstantNotificationListener, OperationSynchronizer

    public abstract class NotificationListener
extends Object
    An abstract class for receiving notification events.

    When you need to listen for a given notification code, you need to extend this class and add an instance of it to the appropriate Notifier.

    See the Notifier documentation to learn more about how you can use notifications in the simulation.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Samy Sadi , Belabbas Yagoubi

    • Constructor Detail

      • NotificationListener

        public NotificationListener()

    • Method Detail

      • canBeNotified

        public final boolean canBeNotified()
        Returns true if this NotificationListener can be notified again. false is returned when this NotificationListener has reached its notification limit and cannot be notified again.
        Returns:
        true if this NotificationListener can be notified again

      • discard

        public void discard()
        Marks this listener as discarded.

        Note this listener will remain referenced on all entities where it was registered. It is only effectively removed by the Notifier when calling a notify method or when it explicitly asked for using the Notifier.cleanupListeners() method.

      • isInstantNotification

        public boolean isInstantNotification()
        Returns true if this listener's code needs to be immediately executed after a notification. Have a look at Notifier.notify(int, Object) for more information.

        Note: for most use cases returning false is just fine.

        Returns:
        true if this listener's code needs to be immediately executed after a notification
